benchmark_details.name: KoBBQ: Korean Bias Benchmark for Question Answering
benchmark_details.overview: KoBBQ is a dataset designed to evaluate social biases of language models (LMs) in the Korean context, adapting the English BBQ benchmark to reflect cultural nuances unique to South Korea.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure and analyze social biases in Korean language models through a culturally adapted benchmark.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The perception of social bias can be subjective; further research is needed to explore other bias categories.
out_of_scope_uses: Training models to generate biased content

data.annotation: Templates and samples reflect cultural biases in South Korea

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on correct responses given ambiguous and disambiguated contexts. Bias scores measure model tendencies toward biased answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy correlates with lower bias scores; a balanced assessment combines both aspects.
methodology.validation: Templates validated through a survey of 100 South Koreans for demographic representation.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Demographic details were collected to ensure broad representation in survey validation.
targeted_risks.harm: Misinterpretations of the biases could perpetuate stereotypes or reinforce biases in LMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participants in surveys were ensured privacy and anonymity.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset usage is restricted to non-malicious applications.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from all participants involved in the survey.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Study conducted under approval from KAIST IRB.
